Description: Plan du Portique, one of three studies for Plate 54 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; various ground plans showing arrangement of temples at Esna, Elephantine, Edfu and Thebes Pen and black ink, with watercolour
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Louis Pierre Baltard. Only the plan at Esna was used to illustrate Plate 54. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
